definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: We'll meet him at the harbour early in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 明天一大早我们将在码头为他饯行。

sentences.english: Waves to slash one of the ship, Adventures of a funeral procession for the drift.
sentences.chinese: 海浪为劈风斩浪的航船饯行，为随波逐流的轻舟送葬。

sentences.english: On the day we left our old home town, we had a going away lunch with our friends from church.
sentences.chinese: 离开老家的那天，我们和教友一起吃了饯行午餐。

sentences.english: We gave him a farewell dinner.
I've been committed to attending the farewell dinner for a long time now.
sentences.chinese: 很早以前我就已经答应参加那个饯行宴会了。

sentences.english: We'll give a farewell dinner for him.
In doing so, he lived a vision that he had outlined over 45 years earlier.
sentences.chinese: 他就是这样饯行了45年之前设定的蓝图。

definition: to hold a welcoming dinner or reception
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
on leaving/on the point of departure
dilute wine/insipid wine/I'm sorry the wine I offer you is so poor (humble)
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
to disperse after a happy time (idiom)/everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up
